long_description: The FMeasure function calculates the accuracy of a test (usually the output of a classifier).

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The relation that contains the output of a classifier
input_tables.description: The relation that contains the output of a classifier

argument_clauses.name: ObsColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the observed class.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the observed class.

argument_clauses.name: PredictColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table column that contains the predicted class.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the predicted class.

argument_clauses.name: Beta
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the value of β in the general formula in “Background”. The beta_value must be a positive DOUBLE PRECISION value. The default value is 1.0.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the value of β in the F-measure formula that the function implements. The beta_value must be a positive DOUBLE PRECISION value. Default: 1.0

argument_clauses.name: classes
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the class or classes to output in the result. The default is all classes.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the class or classes to output in the result. Default: All classes

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
